title: Finding Values Above the Median Based off a Five Number Summary
question_text: A data set consists of $21$ observations. The five number summary for the data is: Min: $10$ Q1: $14$ Median: $19$ Q3: $27$ Max: $40$ Based off the five number summary how many values are ALWAYS above $19$ ?
correct_answer: Choice 'B' is the correct answer. The median will occur at the 11th value as this is the middle value when there are 21 values.
